pages.text: In both [gardens], fruits, dates and pomegranates
So, which of your Lordճ Means of Power will you deny
In these [gardens] are things excellent and beautiful
So, which of your Lordճ Means of Power will you deny
[In those gardens is companionship of] modest Houris in pavilions
So, which of your Lordճ Means of Power will you deny
[Houris] whom neither man nor any jinn had ever touched before
So, which of your Lordճ Means of Power will you deny
[Dwellers of Paradise] recline upon green meadows and beautiful carpets
So, which of your Lordճ Means of Power will you deny
Blessed is the Name of your Lord, Majestic and Glorified
When the Inevitable [the Hour i.e. the time when the present world will end and the Hereafter begin] happens
None would there be to deny its happening —
That will make those down (dead and buried in the dust) rise up
When the earth will be shaken with a [terrible] shake
And the mountains will be crumbled with an [awful] crumbling
And become scattered dust
And you shall be [divided] into three categories
Then those on the right (righteous people) — how will those on the right be
And those on the left (unrighteous people) — how will those on the left be
And those in the front — those will be in the front
Those will be the near ones (near to their Lord)
In the Gardens of Bliss
Many from the earlier peoples
And a few from later times
On couches embedded with gold and precious stones
Reclining on them, face to face one with another
